model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Hi there, I was wondering if you'd like to join me for lunch on Tuesday at the school cafeteria.
Oh, sure. Thanks for the invitation. What time were you thinking?
Noon works for me. Is that okay with you?
Yeah, that works for me. Thanks for asking me to join you.
No problem, it'll be great to catch up. Hey, do you remember when we talked about me being irresponsible a few years ago?
Yeah, I remember that conversation. What about it?
Well, I wanted to share some good news with you. I've been recently promoted to the night shift and have been doing a great job. I think I've come a long way since those days.
That's awesome, congratulations! I'm proud of you and all the hard work you've put in. You've definitely grown and matured in the workplace.
Thank you, I appreciate that. But I have to admit, I'm still a bit nervous about being wrong. Remember when we talked about my constantly questioning myself and second-guessing my decisions?
Yeah, I remember that. Is there anything specific that's been bothering you?
Not really, it's just a general feeling of uncertainty at times. But hey, speaking of uncertainty, do you remember when we talked about my love for singing a while ago?
Yes, I do. How's that been going for you?

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Work and promotion', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers A talks about adjusting to the night shift and excitement for a promotion.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: Hey, have you seen the latest news article I wrote for last night's shift? ### Co-workers B: Yeah, I actually read it this morning. It was really well-written and informative. ### Co-workers A: Thanks! I'm still adjusting to the night shift schedule, but I'm really excited for this promotion. ### Co-workers B: I'm sure you'll do great. You've always been a reliable journalist, even when we worked together on that big story a couple years ago. ### Co-workers A: Yeah, that was a tough story to cover. But I learned a lot from that experience, like the importance of double-checking my sources and making sure the information is accurate before publishing. ### Co-workers B: Definitely. It's important to be responsible in our line of work. Speaking of responsibility, have you been able to handle the night shift schedule okay? ### Co-workers A: It's definitely an adjustment, but I'm managing. I've been making sure to get enough rest during the day and staying focused during my shift. ### Co-workers B: Good to hear. You've always been responsible when it comes to your work, even if you're not always the most responsible in other aspects of your life. ### Co-workers A: ### Yeah, I guess that's true. But I take my job seriously and being reliable is a top priority for me. ### Co-workers B: And that's why I'm not surprised you got this promotion. Keep up the good work.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Support and encouragement', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers B reassures Co-workers A about handling new responsibilities and encourages self-belief.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: Okay, thanks for the advice. You know, speaking of mistakes, I still feel terrible about what happened a few years ago with your arrest. ### Co-workers B: It's okay, I've moved on from that. But I do appreciate your concern. ### Co-workers A: I just wish I had thought about how my actions would affect you. I've been trying to be more responsible and considerate since then. ### Co-workers B: I've noticed the change in you, and I appreciate it. We all make mistakes, but it's important to take responsibility for our actions and try to do better.' }
```
